newsitem.title: MEXICO: Caspian says starts Corvi with buy rating.
newsitem.headline: Caspian says starts Corvi with buy rating.

text.p: Caspian Securities said on Friday that it started coverage of Mexican grocery wholesaler Grupo Corvi with a buy rating at a price of 7.32 pesos per share.

"We believe Corvi will grow rapidly over the next three years due to consolidation of the domestic grocery distribution sector to favor large and efficient wholesalers; the company's strong financial position; a domestic economic recovery; and partial divestiture of or alliance in the company's chocolate subsidiary," Caspian said.
"Our 12-month price target is 10.9 pesos per share, representing a 48.9 percent peso return and a 25.3 percent U.S. dollar return."
